transcript.title: FOR PRESS: ECONOMIC CONSULTATIONS - STATEMENT BY THE PRIME MINISTER, MR. JOHN GORTON
transcript.content:
FOR PRESS P. M. No. 26, 1969
ECONOM. C CONSULTATiONS
Statement by the Prime Minister, Mr dahn Gorton
The Government met with represeatatives of industry
and commerce in Canberra today.
Today's discussions were with national organisations
representing primiary industries, manufacturing industries and
commerce. The Government saw these organisations in three separate
groups, thereby continuing the practice begun in j-, My last year.
The talks were again worthwhile in providing Ministers
with an up-to-date appreciation of the views of those directly involved
in commerce and industry.
The series of economic consultations will continue
tomorrow when Ministers will hold separate discussions with representatives
of the Export Development Council, the Manufacturing Industries
Advisory Council and the Australian Council of Trade Unions.
Attached is a list of those taking part in today's talks.
CANBERRA, March 1969

NATIONAL ORGANISATIONS REPRESENTED AT
ECONOMIC CONSULTATIONS
MARCH 1969
Primary Industry Group
National Farmers' Union
of Australia President Mr F. J. McAvoy, CBE
Australian Primary Producers'
Union President Mr R. B. Gerrand
Australian Wool Growers' and
Graziers' Council President Mr B. A. Wright
Australian Wool and Meat
Producers' Federation President Mr R. V. Sewell, OBE
Australian Wheat Growers'
Federation President Mr T. M. Saint
Australian Mining Industry
Council President Mr N. S. Kirby
Manufacturing Industry Group
Associated Chambers of
Manufactures of Australia President Mr J. C. Campbell
Master Builders' Federation
of Australia President Mr R. A. O'Neill
Federal Chamber of Automotive Executive
Industries Member Mr N. W. Lawrance
Commercial Group
Associated Chambers of
Commerce of Australia President Mr B. R. Macklin
Australian Bankers' Association Chairman Mr C. H. Rennie
Australian Council of Retailers President Mr T. Luxton, DSO, MBE
